titleInfo.title: (Karnak) Piliers de Thoutmès III. Papyrus et Lotus.

mods.abstract: Papyrus and lotus pillars, court of Thutmose III, Temple of Amen at Karnak, East Thebes (New Kingdom Dynasty XVIII); two partially intact papyrus and lotus pillars among a ruined section of the Court of Thutmose III, part of the pharoah's extensive building project at Karnak within the Temple of Amen, two Egyptian men pose before pillars (left) "(Karnak) Piliers de Thoutmès III. Papyrus et Lotus. 1102 Photog. Artistique G. Lekegian & Co" in white along bottom of print. (Number on object is 16/655).

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
